formatted_address: 2 Stadium Walk, #01-02/03 Singapore Indoor Stadium, Singapore 397691
name: Thai Village Restaurant (Singapore Indoor Stadium)

reviews.text:
Amazing food and service!

The last time we dined here, the price was $60, but now it's $88—yet it’s absolutely worth it. Every dish was expertly prepared and bursting with flavor. Ms. Keng Huay provided exceptional service, and her team was incredibly attentive. Our tea was refilled promptly, and used plates were cleared quickly. We arrived before the Disney show started, and we didn’t regret a single moment. **We’ll definitely be back!**

**P.S.** *Highly recommend the vermicelli crab*—don’t forget to scrape the bottom for the charred garlic and pork belly. So delicious!

Having the Shark's Fin here from SGD 60 till now is 88 already, but luckily the taste is still nice and the other food here is 99% always nice.

One time tried an abalone, dry one quite large but extremly expensive and not good... This time the smaller one tasted so nice and just cost around 50.

Thai Tofu is always my dad's favorite, but my favorite is the dessert 芋泥~ now is no more tooooo sweet and dry, very smooth.

Yesterday didn't order the Crab Vermicelli cuz just having the crab last week, but the Crab Vermicelli also very nice. Who loves the coriander & chili must give a try!!

Popular with the older crowd.
They have 20% discount during your birthday month if you are a member (free to join)

Restaurant does not have a toilet so you have to use the public one which is really yucky.

Wasabi prawn looks unnaturally green.
Food is mostly average but crab beehoon is exceptional.

Will not specially come back again.
Sharkfin is good and rich.. prawn vermicelli is another recommendation. Service crew and manager are very polite and attentive
we have been here for years. scrumptious dinner for two. must to have their sharkfin soup and abalone rice. yums!
